Apple orchard under bare fallow with trickle irrigation.  Investigation of soil hydraulic properties and biomass production.
Investigation of hydraulic properties and biomass production for apple orchard under trickle irrigation.
The site is located on the eastern coastal fringe of India in Sunderbans delta.  The area is salt affected and partly waterlogged.  The land capability is class II.
Glacio-fluvial-lacustrine deposits in the Glacial Lake Dakota Basin which have been reworked by wind to some extent.
Nonirrigated center-pivot irrigated potato field covered with winter barley.  Formed in coarse textured deposits left by glacial melt water and reworked by wind.
Nonirrigated wheat field.  Formed in coarse textured deposits left by glacial melt water and reworked by wind.
Nonirrigated wheat field.  Formed in moderately coarse and coarse textured deposits left by glacial melt waters.  Somewhat poorly drained, calcareous soil in slight depression on lake plain.
Nonirrigated wheat field.  Poorly and very poorly drained calcareous soil on sandy upland formed in moderately coarse to coarse textured deposits left by glacial melt water.
Nonirrigated corn field.  Deep nearly level to steep well-drained soils formed in medium textured glacial till, found on glacial and sand-mantled till plains.
Nonirrigated corn field.  Deep nearly level to steep well-drained soils formed in medium-textured glacial till, found on glacial and sand-mantled till plains.

Site was located in a broad, nearly depressional area in a fallow field.  Poorly to very poorly drained alkali soils on lake plains occurring as nearly level areas or slight depressions formed in moderately coarse and coarse textured deposits left by glacial melt water.

Nonirrigated corner of a center-pivot irrigated cornfield.  Deep, well drained soils on uplands, alluvial fans and foot slopes in the James River Valley and on lake plains formed in medium textured deposits left by glacial melt water.

Nonirrigated corner of a center-pivot irrigated cornfield.  Deep, well-drained soils on uplands, alluvial fans and foot slopes in the James River Valley and on lake plains formed in medium textured deposits left by glacial melt water.

Nonirrigated wheat field.  Deep, moderately well-drained, nearly level to gently sloping soils on uplands, terraces and lower foot slopes in the James River Valley formed in deposits left by glacial melt water.
The area was 15 m by 15 m on a relatively flat portion of a severely eroded slope (0-20%) that had been in bermuda grass for years.
Plot area had been in pasture, with 2-5% slope, (Bermuda grass) for many years.
